alert.note: Alert for Carter; Custer; Fallon; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 1:25AM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills of 40 to 55 below zero this morning, warming to 20 to 40 below zero this afternoon through Tuesday morning. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Montana. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 AM this morning to 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: People are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Keep pets indoors as much as possible.
